thread.title: The curious case of D.J. Foster
thread.title_full: The curious case of D.J. Foster

title: The curious case of D.J. Foster
text:
The curious case of D.J. Foster What has happened to D.J. Foster? Post to Facebook The curious case of D.J. Foster What has happened to D.J. Foster?   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1LGNRso   Join the Conversation To   The curious case of D.J. Foster Robby Baker , 12 Sports 1:12 p.m. MST October 19, 2015 What has happened to D.J. Foster? Sep 26, 2015; Tempe, AZ, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils wide receiver D.J. Foster (8) against the Southern California Trojans at Sun Devil Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Where oh where has D.J. Foster gone? 
The running back turned wide receiver is one of the most athletically gifted players in all of the Pac-12, and yet he is an afterthought in this year's ASU offense. 
Foster has been a staple in Tempe over his career, and this season became only the fourth player in NCAA history to have 2,000 yards receiving and 2,000 yards rushing in his career. 
Sep 26, 2015; Tempe, AZ, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils wide receiver D.J. Foster (8) against the Southern California Trojans at Sun Devil Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports) 
This year though, he's accounted for 468 total yards and three touchdowns. 
To put that number in perspective, he accounted for 1,769 total yards last season. 
Clearly the decision to make him a wide receiver hasn't worked out. 
The local product out of Saguaro High School welcomed the change during the offseason though, and it was a logical move given all the depth and talent ASU had in its backfield. 
But it's not working. 
Foster is a playmaker, and he needs to get more touches. 
Oct 10, 2015; Tempe, AZ, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils wide receiver D.J. Foster (8) makes a touchdown catch against the Colorado Buffaloes during the second half at Sun Devil Stadium. The Sun Devils won 48-23. Mandatory Credit: Joe Camporeale-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Joe Camporeale, Joe Camporeale-USA TODAY Sports) 
Gone are the days of Foster breaking big touchdown runs. Gone are the days of Foster catching bubble screens and torching defenses. 
Now D.J. Foster has become a receiver good for about four receptions and 50 yards per game. How has one of the most gifted players in the Pac-12 seen his career come to this? 
Sun Devil fans can add the team's use of Foster to their list of head scratchers this season has produced. 
As ASU heads into their bye week, it's time for some reevaluation. 
No more talk of National Championships, or Pac-12 titles for that matter. 
It's time to get back to the basics and highlight the best players on the roster instead of turning them into an afterthought. Read or Share this story: http://12ne.ws/1LGNRso TOP VIDEOS
